intro: Oxytropis gilgitensis, commonly known as the Gilgit oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, particularly in Pakistan and India. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pea-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it thrives in rocky, arid environments. Oxytropis gilgitensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters.
